Articles.Content:
What would you think about a kerbal space program musical? We could make the story and the lines and stuff, maybe see if any youtubers would like to help and sing, and then we could publish the whole thing on youtube. It would be very interesting to say the least. I haven't heard of any other games that have musicals attached to them- i know there are some, but i don't know of them.

On the other hand, i guess some people think musicals are dumb. I don't really, but that's my opinion.

What do you think?
If you want to do it then go for it. Musicals aren't exactly my forte (ba dum tss) but I can't speak for everyone.

At first, my reaction was what it normally is when someone suggests making other media based on a game, "oh god no". But then I remembered the "You Ain't Going Home" song that one guy did, and also what musicals are usually actually like, and I bet this community could write some pretty delightful lyrics.

I have no singing talent and will be too busy with college to do much for this I'm afraid, but I really hope it takes off!

"Nonesense, I am one who delights in all manifestations of the terpsichorean Muse." Seriously though it'd hafta be one heck of a musical- not really my cuppa tea, but I do like KSP so I'm halfway there already.

You can do it! See, once these bicycle mechanics thought hey, lets put wings on a bike, and look where that went.

Moving this to the Fan Works subforum

I for one find this idea highly amusing. If something does come of this, I'd like to see the end result.
Me too. Show me the Broadway super Kerbal Musical!
The issue would be the cost of pyrotechnics, because to do it properly we would have to put Michael Bay to shame.
I'm getting the president on the line. We need full government funding, stat!
I have full habilitation on JJ Abrams Lens Flares fx, with i can help...

Hell yeah! I'd be up for that. We'd need to get Giorgio Moroder to do the music, and Tim Rice to do the lyrics. I want Brian May as Jeb, Dennis DeYoung as Bill, and Justin Hayward as Bob. It needs Tim Curry too and Phil Collins too, but I'm not sure in which roles.

What would you think about a kerbal space program musical? We could make the story and the lines and stuff, maybe see if any youtubers would like to help and sing, and then we could publish the whole thing on youtube. It would be very interesting to say the least. I haven't heard of any other games that have musicals attached to them- i know there are some, but i don't know of them.

On the other hand, i guess some people think musicals are dumb. I don't really, but that's my opinion.

What do you think?

It needs Tim Curry too ... but I'm not sure in which roles.

Would it be a KSP musical without reference to the time-warp feature?

Just saying...

Would it be a KSP musical without reference to the time-warp feature?

Just saying...

Oh - not again...

Hmm, a Rocky Horror / KSP crossover musical. I'm not sure whether that would be the most awesome thing evah, or just deeply, deeply disturbing...

I'd volunteer to write song lyrics or cut video!

I can't sing at all, though.

This could be cool. KSP already has quite the repository of songs, both written and recorded.

For example, I'm currently involved in planning [CLASSIFIED] and hope to write [CLASSIFIED] ventually.

Edited September 10, 2014 by Tw1
